title: Ex-OpenAI Chief Research Officer: What Comes Next for AI?

rawLines.text: Boba greu is the chief research officer
at open aai for 6 and a half years he
recently left a few months ago and we
had the privilege of unsupervised
learning of being one of the first
podcasts he come on so it was an
opportunity to ask him literally
everything about the future of AI we
talked about whether models have hit a
wall we talked about robotics models
video models computer use models and the
timelining capabilities that Bob
envisions in the future we talked about
open ai's unique culture and what made
research so effective there and also
some of the key decision points and what
it was like to live through them we hit
on why AGI might not feel that different
than how things feel today and Bob also
shared why he left open Ai and what's
next I think folks are really going to
enjoy this episode without further Ado
here's
Bob well Bob thanks so much for for
coming on the podcast thanks for having
me here this will be fun really excited
to uh to have you um I know we'll hit on

we just start with a question that I

100x increase in effective compute
that's what that increment means and so
uh you get that by a combination of you

algorithmic improvements you know you
can get a you can get some out of them
